intro: Epilobium jucundum, commonly known as the sweet willow or velvetleaf willow, is a herbaceous plant native to Europe and parts of Asia. It belongs to the family Onagraceae and is characterized by its slender, erect stems and opposite, lance-shaped leaves. The plant produces small, pink to purple flowers that bloom in clusters, typically from late spring to early summer. Epilobium jucundum is often found in moist soils near streams, marshes, or along riverbanks. It is also known for its medicinal properties and has been used historically in traditional herbal remedies.
